revealed in mine ears by the Lord of hosts. Isaiah witnesses that the Lord revealed the prophecy found in Isa. 22:1-14.

Surely this iniquity shall not be purged from you till ye die. The New International Version reads, "'Til your dying day this sin will not be atoned for." In very strong language Isaiah testifies that Judah has gone beyond the point of repentance and will not receive forgiveness in this life for her sins. His revelation closes with the affirmation that it is the Lord who has spoken, "saith the Lord God of hosts."
